abstract.p: Ashanti Goldfields says second-quarter pretax profit dropped 54 percent, to $7.9 million, hurt by decline in price of gold (S)

block.p: One of Africa's biggest mining companies, Ashanti Goldfields, said second-quarter pretax profit plummeted 54 percent, to 7.9 million, hurt by a decline in the price of gold. Hurt last year by bungled bets on the future price of gold, Ashanti nearly collapsed into bankruptcy but its crisis eased after securing new lines of credit and selling a stake in a Tanzanian mine to AngloGold. Ashanti operates mines in Ghana, Guinea and Tanzania and Zimbabwe.
